item.title: As Palestinians Return to Gaza City, Elation and Despair Mix
item.description: As families reunite, they also confront the devastation wrought by the 15-month war that flattened neighborhoods and killed tens of thousands.

item.title: They Fled a Rebel Advance. Then the Rebels Marched on Their Refuge.
item.description: People who fled M23 rebels around Goma, in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, have found themselves with nowhere left to go.

item.title: Vietnam’s Drivers, Facing Steep Fines, Are Minding the Rules of the Road
item.description: Steep new fines — more than many people make in a month — have made the streets of Ho Chi Minh City and Hanoi less freewheeling than they used to be.

item.title: U.S. Move to Suspend Mine Clearing Funds Alarms Vietnam
item.description: Large swaths of land in Southeast Asia are littered with unexploded bombs dropped by American forces during the Vietnam War.

item.title: India, China to Resume Direct Flights After Nearly Five Years
item.description: It was the latest thaw in relations between the two countries, whose troops were involved in deadly skirmishes high in the Himalayas in 2020.
